meanings.definition: A defined path on an airport for taxiing aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot guided the plane along the taxiway towards the runway.
meanings.sent2: The airport crew painted new lines on the taxiway for better visibility.
meanings.sent3: The taxiway was so busy with planes that it looked like a colorful parade.
meanings.sent4: The taxiway stretched out like a long, winding road for the airplanes.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights along the taxiway guided the aircraft safely to their gates.

meanings.definition: To move an aircraft on a taxiway.
meanings.sent1: The ground crew will taxi the airplane to the designated taxiway.
meanings.sent2: The pilot carefully taxiwayed the plane towards the hangar.
meanings.sent3: The airplane decided to taxiway in circles just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The aircraft seemed to taxiway effortlessly as if it had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent5: The captain skillfully taxiwayed the jet through the maze of taxiways at the airport.
